page.title: 19BRITISH RAIL, THATCHAM.
page.content: Thatcham station was built in the 1840s. In 1940 The station had a full staff of 23 and some 120 trains passed through each day of which number a dozen in each direction were stopping trains. In early 1965, Thatcham became an un-manned station. After the withdrawal of Thatcham's station staff, fares were collected by guards on 'paytrains'. In November 1965 the station buildings at Thatcham were demolished along with the footbridge (erected in 1908). In 1967 level crossing barriers replaced the old gates. In 1978 the signal box was demolished when automatic signalling was installed on the line. Long queues of cars and lorries now form either side of the level crossing when the barriers are down waiting for the trains to pass through.
